page.title: 08DE LA POLE : PATIENTS
page.content: De La Pole hospital is one hundred and one years old. It has always been a pyschiatric hospital being built for that purpose in Victorian times. Its catchment area includes most of North Humberside but most of the patients come from the Hull area. Most patients are admitted for psychiatrc treatment. 474 beds are set aside for these problems compared to 45 for orhopaedic care, however an increasing number of psychiatric patients are elderly people whose mental problems are a product of old age., rather than the result of the stress of modern life. To care for all these people there is a staff of full and part-time nurses equivalent to 638 full timers.
